content.description: Very short but decent route.  Climb the face, make a funky mantel, done.
content.location: Far right side of the crag.

content.description: Boulder up about 10', then follow 2 bolts in a left-facing corner.  The crux involves bumping past a couple of right-hand edges to a left-hand slot at the third bolt.  Some might be tempted to rock over to the ledge on the right at the third bolt and follow the arete, but it probably won't be any easier, and it definitely didn't get cleaned.
content.location: Furthest bolted route to the right.

content.description: Moderate climbing on a pillar past the first 3 bolts.  The crux comes at the 4th bolt, making a long move over a bulge, past a couple of sinker pockets to a jug rail.  The crux is height-dependent and will probably feel a fair bit harder if you're under 5'9".
content.location: Furthest route left, above the talus field.

content.description: Funky climbing in a dihedral leads to a surprisingly difficult mantel into a ledge.  Thin moves off the ledge ease into big edges before the anchor.

Nice left-facing corner that ends too quickly.  Boulder up the first section, place a 3-4" cam, and head up into the excellent hand crack.  The crux probably comes reaching the ledge at about 2/3 height.

The crack takes excellent gear, but take care placing it.  Much of the outer few inches of crack is badly flaring, but becomes nicely parallel as it moves further back.
content.location: Obvious left-facing corner on the left-center side of the wall, behind a large pine tree.

content.description: Start on a pillar with a high-ish first bolt and quickly pull the route's crux, mantling/scumming your way onto a ledge.  The rest of the route is a bit easier but good climbing in a flake/wide crack system.
content.location: Second bolted route from the right, in the middle of the wall.  Follows an obvious flake system.

content.description: Slightly overhanging and pure fun, this route features juggy liebacks and big flat edges.  The first crux comes getting to the first bolt (be careful), and the second comes finagling your way to the anchors.
content.location: Third route from the left, just right of a small tree growing out of the wall about halfway up.

content.description: Clip the first bolt of "Kill 'Em All", then head left up the slab. The first crux comes moving off small crimps and bad feet to a huge jug. Second crux comes pulling off a small ledge onto a right-facing flake...hike your feet and go.
content.location: Second bolted route from the left, just right of an undercut cave.

content.description: Killer steep climbing on a well-featured, blocky wall.  Sustained 5.11 with a short .12- crux about halfway up, moving into a right-hand gaston/fingerlock off a left-hand crimp.  Above, the wall steepens with big moves between big holds. Second crux clipping the chains.
